ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I loved exploring Biblical storylines from a critical perspective, tracking interpretations of the text throughout history. It was a new and refreshing way for me to explore Torah.
I gained the skills and knowledge to better appreciate the methods by which Midrash performs exegesis.
I broadened and matured my understanding of types of Biblical interpretation. My textual analysis and critical thinking were improved.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is an incredible class! Professor Hayes is an amazing scholar, a kind person, and a great pedagogue- three things that are not often combined! The content of the class is fascinating- it is the kind of class you look forward to attending.

I liked that the class was small and that we got to have intimate, in depth conversations about the texts. However, we pretty much only looked at primary sources, which I sometimes felt like we exhausted. There was a point at which I felt like we had done all the thinking there was to do about a given biblical story and its midrashim/targums. Maybe that wasn't accurate, but it felt like that.
This course was structured well. The workload was manageable and I appreciated that most of the learning happened during class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely -- Some of the topics we covered dragged on a bit, but overall, it's a fun course that offers insight into Midrashic interpretations of the Bible. Just a heads up -- you're technically not required to know Biblical Hebrew, but it was used a lot in class.
YES! This course is intellectually engaging, the content is fascinating, and professor Hayes is brilliant.

This course offers a great framework for thinking about the midrashic process as a whole. It changed how I go about interpreting the construction of rabbinic texts. Each student is tasked with presenting a subsection of text each seminar, which facilitates discussion and in depth understanding of texts nicely. Writing assignments are manageable.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student! Prof. Hayes is an amazing professor, and brings a unique perspective to studying Jewish texts. I learned so much with her. The course was engaging, interesting, and fun!
I would recommend this class to people looking to expand their understanding of the function of midrash.
